meta.description: Curated database of HLA allele associations with Type 2 Diabetes, LADA, and related metabolic phenotypes
sources: Howson et al. 2011 - HLA class II gene associations in T2D (Diabetologia)
Jacobsen et al. 2018 - HLA and T2D risk in Scandinavian cohorts
Yasuda et al. 2016 - HLA-DRB1 and T2D in Japanese populations (J Hum Genet)
Tuomi et al. 2014 - Latent autoimmune diabetes in adults (Diabetes Care)
Buzzetti et al. 2017 - LADA management: NIRAD study (Diabetes Care)
Mahajan et al. 2018 - Multi-ancestry GWAS of T2D (Nature Genetics)

mhc_region.description: Major Histocompatibility Complex (MHC) on chromosome 6p21.3. Contains ~260 genes, the most gene-dense and polymorphic region in the human genome.

HLA-A.full_name: Major Histocompatibility Complex, Class I, A
HLA-A.function: Presents intracellular peptides to CD8+ T cells. Involved in NK cell regulation via KIR interactions.
HLA-A.role_in_t2d: Indirect role through NK cell-mediated adipose tissue inflammation and beta-cell stress.

HLA-B.full_name: Major Histocompatibility Complex, Class I, B
HLA-B.function: Presents intracellular peptides to CD8+ cytotoxic T cells. Most polymorphic class I gene.
HLA-B.role_in_t2d: Modulates inflammatory response in metabolic syndrome. Some alleles affect beta-cell autoimmunity threshold.

HLA-C.full_name: Major Histocompatibility Complex, Class I, C
HLA-C.function: Ligand for KIR receptors on NK cells. Regulates innate immune activation threshold.
HLA-C.role_in_t2d: KIR/HLA-C interactions modulate adipose tissue macrophage polarization and insulin resistance.

HLA-DRB1.full_name: Major Histocompatibility Complex, Class II, DR Beta 1
HLA-DRB1.function: Presents extracellular peptides to CD4+ helper T cells. Key determinant of adaptive immune response specificity.
HLA-DRB1.role_in_t2d: Central role in T2D-associated inflammation. Specific alleles modulate Th1/Th2/Th17 balance affecting insulin resistance and beta-cell autoimmunity in LADA.

HLA-DQA1.full_name: Major Histocompatibility Complex, Class II, DQ Alpha 1
HLA-DQA1.function: Alpha chain of HLA-DQ heterodimer. Forms peptide-binding groove with DQB1.
HLA-DQA1.role_in_t2d: DQA1/DQB1 haplotypes are the strongest HLA determinants of autoimmune diabetes risk, relevant for LADA classification.

HLA-DQB1.full_name: Major Histocompatibility Complex, Class II, DQ Beta 1
HLA-DQB1.function: Beta chain of HLA-DQ heterodimer. Contains the primary polymorphic residues in the peptide-binding groove.
HLA-DQB1.role_in_t2d: Position 57 (Asp vs non-Asp) is the single most important residue for diabetes risk. DQB1*06:02 is strongly protective, DQB1*03:02 confers risk.

HLA-DPB1.full_name: Major Histocompatibility Complex, Class II, DP Beta 1
HLA-DPB1.function: Beta chain of HLA-DP. Less studied than DR/DQ but emerging role in metabolic inflammation.
HLA-DPB1.role_in_t2d: Weaker associations reported. May modulate macrophage antigen presentation in adipose tissue.

allele_associations.description: Consistently protective against T2D across European populations. Associated with lower HbA1c and improved insulin sensitivity. Part of the DR15-DQ6 haplotype.
allele_associations.mechanism: Promotes Treg differentiation and anti-inflammatory cytokine profile in adipose tissue. Enhances tolerance to islet autoantigens.

allele_associations.description: Strong risk allele for LADA (Latent Autoimmune Diabetes in Adults) and GAD-antibody positive T2D. The hallmark LADA HLA allele.
allele_associations.mechanism: Presents islet autoantigens (GAD65, IA-2) to CD4+ T cells, triggering autoimmune beta-cell destruction. Activates Th1 pathways.

allele_associations.description: Risk for both T1D and LADA. In T2D context, especially relevant for adult-onset autoimmune diabetes. Synergizes with DRB1*03:01.
allele_associations.mechanism: High-affinity presentation of proinsulin and GAD65 epitopes. DRB1*04:01/03:01 heterozygotes have highest LADA risk.

allele_associations.description: Risk allele specific to East Asian populations (Japanese, Chinese, Korean). One of the strongest T2D-HLA associations in non-European ancestry.
allele_associations.mechanism: Promotes inflammatory macrophage activation in visceral adipose tissue. May enhance presentation of bacterial peptides from gut dysbiosis.

allele_associations.description: Protective against LADA and autoimmune T2D in European populations. Counteracts autoimmune beta-cell destruction.
allele_associations.mechanism: Poor presenter of key islet autoantigens. Promotes Th2 skewing and IL-10 production.

allele_associations.description: Protective in multiple populations. Associated with better metabolic profile and lower inflammatory markers.
allele_associations.mechanism: Promotes regulatory T cell activity. Associated with lower TNF-alpha and IL-6 in metabolic syndrome.

allele_associations.description: The most protective HLA allele against autoimmune diabetes. Asp57 in the peptide-binding groove is the key protective residue. Strongly protective against both T1D and LADA component of T2D.
allele_associations.mechanism: Asp57 forms a salt bridge with Arg76 of HLA-DQA1, stabilizing the P9 pocket. This prevents high-affinity binding of diabetogenic peptides from insulin and GAD65.

allele_associations.description: Major risk allele for autoimmune diabetes. Non-Asp57 allows diabetogenic peptide presentation. Key component of DR4-DQ8 risk haplotype.
allele_associations.mechanism: Ala57 (non-Asp) creates a positively charged P9 pocket that binds insulin B:9-23 and GAD65 epitopes with high affinity, activating autoreactive CD4+ T cells.

allele_associations.description: Strong LADA risk allele. Part of DR3-DQ2 haplotype. Non-Asp57. Particularly relevant for GAD-antibody positive T2D patients.
allele_associations.mechanism: Presents GAD65 peptides with high efficiency. Trans-complementation with DQA1*05:01 creates the highest-risk DQ heterodimer for autoimmune diabetes.

allele_associations.description: Moderate risk for classical T2D (non-autoimmune). More prevalent in African populations. Associated with insulin resistance phenotype.
allele_associations.mechanism: May enhance inflammatory antigen presentation in adipose tissue macrophages, promoting M1 polarization and insulin resistance.

allele_associations.description: T2D risk allele predominantly in East Asian populations. Part of DR9-DQ9 haplotype. Asp57-positive but still diabetogenic through alternative mechanisms.
allele_associations.mechanism: Unique P4 pocket configuration allows presentation of metabolic stress-derived peptides. Activates Th17 cells in the pancreatic microenvironment.

allele_associations.description: Associated with accelerated beta-cell loss in T2D. Very common in East Asian and Latin American populations. Linked to fulminant T1D in Japan.
allele_associations.mechanism: Presents beta-cell peptides to CD8+ cytotoxic T cells with high efficiency. May accelerate beta-cell apoptosis through granzyme/perforin pathway even in T2D context.

allele_associations.description: Modest T2D risk in European populations. The most studied class I allele. Presents insulin-derived peptides (InsB10-18) to CD8+ T cells.
allele_associations.mechanism: A*02:01-restricted CD8+ T cells targeting preproinsulin signal peptide are found in T2D patients with residual autoimmunity.

allele_associations.description: Risk for rapid-onset diabetes with features overlapping T2D and fulminant T1D. Primarily reported in East Asian populations.
allele_associations.mechanism: Efficient presentation of viral mimicry peptides that cross-react with beta-cell antigens. May trigger acute beta-cell destruction after viral infection.

allele_associations.description: T2D risk allele in Japanese populations. Associated with metabolic syndrome components including visceral obesity and dyslipidemia.
allele_associations.mechanism: Modulates NK cell activity through KIR3DL1 interaction, potentially altering adipose tissue immune surveillance.

allele_associations.description: Weak T2D association through NK cell regulation. HLA-C expression levels affect insulin resistance through adipose tissue inflammation.
allele_associations.mechanism: Low-expression HLA-C allele. Reduced NK cell inhibition leads to increased adipose tissue macrophage activation and insulin resistance.

allele_associations.description: Modestly protective. The most common DPB1 allele worldwide. May promote immune tolerance in the pancreatic microenvironment.
allele_associations.mechanism: Weak peptide-binding groove promotes low-affinity interactions, facilitating Treg induction rather than effector T cell activation.

snp_associations.description: Strongest HLA-region SNP for T2D in GWAS. Tags DQA1*03 alleles. Genome-wide significant across multiple ancestries.
Independent T2D signal in the HLA class II region. May affect DQB2 regulatory elements and immune cell activation in pancreatic islets.
Tags DR3 and DR4 haplotypes. Proxy for high-risk DRB1 alleles in GWAS when classical HLA typing unavailable.
GWAS-significant T2D locus in HLA-DQB1 region. Effects may be mediated through DQB1 expression levels rather than allele-specific peptide binding.
Protective variant in DQB1 coding region. Tags Asp57+ alleles (DQB1*06:02, *03:01). The Asp57 effect captured at SNP level.
HLA-DRA region variant associated with T2D. May affect DRA expression and antigen presentation efficiency.

haplotype_risks.description: Highest-risk HLA genotype for LADA. Compound heterozygotes generate trans-complementary DQ heterodimers (DQA1*05:01/DQB1*03:02) with extreme diabetogenic capacity.
High-risk haplotype. DQ8 (DQA1*03:01-DQB1*03:02) presents insulin B:9-23 with high affinity. Risk amplified by DRB1*04:01 linkage.
High-risk haplotype for LADA. DQ2 (DQA1*05:01-DQB1*02:01) is the primary celiac disease allele and also presents GAD65 efficiently.
Moderate risk, primarily in East Asian populations. DR9 is the major T2D-HLA risk allele in Japan.
Strongest protective haplotype. DQB1*06:02 (Asp57) blocks diabetogenic peptide presentation. Even single copy confers dominant protection.
Protective against LADA. Note: DQB1*02:02 (not *02:01) â€” the single amino acid difference at position 135 changes disease risk dramatically.
Protective haplotype with anti-inflammatory properties. Associated with lower CRP and IL-6 levels in metabolic syndrome.

biological_mechanisms.name: Antigen Presentation to CD4+ T Cells
biological_mechanisms.description: HLA Class II molecules present peptides from extracellular proteins (including islet autoantigens) to CD4+ helper T cells. The specificity of the peptide-binding groove determines which antigens trigger immune responses.
biological_mechanisms.relevance_to_t2d: In LADA and autoimmune T2D, specific HLA-DR/DQ alleles present beta-cell autoantigens (GAD65, IA-2, insulin) leading to T cell-mediated islet destruction.

biological_mechanisms.name: DQB1 Position 57 (Asp57) Effect
biological_mechanisms.description: The single most important amino acid position for diabetes risk. Aspartic acid at position 57 of DQB1 forms a salt bridge that determines the P9 binding pocket structure.
biological_mechanisms.relevance_to_t2d: Non-Asp57 alleles (Ala, Val, Ser) create a positively charged pocket that binds insulin and GAD65 peptides with high affinity, activating diabetogenic T cells.

biological_mechanisms.name: Trans-Complementary DQ Heterodimers
biological_mechanisms.description: In heterozygous individuals, DQA1 and DQB1 chains from different haplotypes can pair to form novel trans-encoded DQ molecules not present in either parent.
biological_mechanisms.relevance_to_t2d: DR3/DR4 heterozygotes form DQA1*05:01/DQB1*03:02 trans-dimer, the single most diabetogenic HLA molecule. Explains the extreme risk of the DR3/DR4 genotype.

biological_mechanisms.name: Adipose Tissue Immune Regulation
biological_mechanisms.description: HLA molecules on adipose tissue macrophages and dendritic cells regulate local immune responses. Class II expression increases in obesity.
biological_mechanisms.relevance_to_t2d: Specific HLA alleles promote M1 macrophage polarization and Th1/Th17 responses in visceral adipose tissue, exacerbating insulin resistance independent of autoimmunity.

biological_mechanisms.name: NK Cell Regulation via HLA Class I/KIR
biological_mechanisms.description: HLA class I molecules serve as ligands for KIR (Killer Immunoglobulin-like Receptors) on NK cells. KIR/HLA interactions regulate NK cell activation threshold.
biological_mechanisms.relevance_to_t2d: KIR/HLA-C genotype combinations affect adipose tissue NK cell activity, influencing macrophage recruitment and insulin resistance in obesity-related T2D.

biological_mechanisms.name: Gut-Immune-Metabolic Axis
biological_mechanisms.description: HLA molecules present bacterial-derived peptides from gut microbiota. Intestinal permeability increases in T2D, exposing immune cells to more bacterial antigens.
biological_mechanisms.relevance_to_t2d: Specific HLA alleles modulate the immune response to gut bacterial antigens, affecting systemic inflammation, incretin signaling, and metabolic endotoxemia.
